name: expert-sql
description: SQL query generation expert trained on text2sql dataset with schema context
author: hivellm

rope_scaling._comment: Qwen3-specific NTK-by-parts scaling (Î²=0.25). Matches Rust implementation (qwen3_model.rs:49-57)

adapters._comment: DoRA r=8-16 for SQL (r=12 balanced). Better quality than LoRA for complex queries (joins, subqueries)

perf._comment: DoRA r=12 needs 18MB VRAM (vs 15MB for LoRA). Grammar validation adds 0.5ms latency.

runtime._comment: Metadata for Rust/Candle runtime. Qwen3 uses custom flash attention kernel (not standard SDPA).

dataset._comment: gretelai/synthetic_text_to_sql: 100k examples, validated & optimized. MySQL->PostgreSQL fixes applied. Only 'text' field (77% smaller).

config._unsloth_comment: Enable Unsloth for 2x faster training and 70% less VRAM. Requires: pip install 'unsloth[windows] @ git+https://github.com/unslothai/unsloth.git'
config._comment: DoRA r=12, LLaMA-Factory optimized params. Lower LR (5e-5) + higher dropout (0.1) for better generalization.
config._batch_comment: Reduced from 6 to 2 for Windows memory safety. Compensated with gradient_accumulation_steps=45 (effective batch=90).
config._warmup_comment: Using warmup_ratio=0.1 (10%, LLaMA-Factory best practice) = ~150 steps. warmup_steps=0 when using ratio.
config._scheduler_comment: Simple cosine decay. More conservative to prevent pattern overfitting.
config._dataloader_comment: Windows fixes: num_workers=0, pin_memory=false, persistent_workers=false. Prevents worker memory copies and leaks.
config._compile_comment: Windows fix: torch_compile=false (Triton incompatible with PyTorch 2.5.1 on Windows). Unsloth provides enough speedup.
config._cuda_graphs_comment: Windows fix: use_cuda_graphs=false (unstable on Windows). CUDA graphs require torch.compile which leaks memory.

decoding._comment: Unsloth/Qwen recommended settings: temp=0.7, top_p=0.8, top_k=20. Prevents repetition collapse. Grammar validation prevents syntax errors.
